abstract: Returns the array of identifier strings for the default toolbar items.
overview:
## Return Value

An array of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSString] objects, each of which contains an identifier for a toolbar item that is part of the default configuration. The order of items in the array is used to set the order of items in the toolbar.

## Discussion

This method is called for tab view interfaces that use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTabViewController/TabStyle-swift.enum/toolbar] style. Use this method to return the default set of toolbar items, including any extra toolbar items you want included. For example, include [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSToolbarItem/Identifier/flexibleSpace] strings as the first and last elements of the array to center the remaining toolbar items. If you add custom identifiers, you must also override the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTabViewController/toolbar(_:itemForItemIdentifier:willBeInsertedIntoToolbar:)] method to specify the content for those toolbar items.

If you override this method, you must call `super` at some point in your implementation. The default implementation of this method returns the identifiers for all toolbar items that correspond to tabs in the tab bar interface.

# toolbarDefaultItemIdentifiers(_:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the array of identifier strings for the default toolbar items.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func toolbarDefaultItemIdentifiers(_ toolbar: NSToolbar) -> [NSToolbarItem.Identifier]
```

## Parameters

- **toolbar**: The toolbar making the request.

## Return Value

An array of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSString] objects, each of which contains an identifier for a toolbar item that is part of the default configuration. The order of items in the array is used to set the order of items in the toolbar.

## Discussion

This method is called for tab view interfaces that use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTabViewController/TabStyle-swift.enum/toolbar] style. Use this method to return the default set of toolbar items, including any extra toolbar items you want included. For example, include [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSToolbarItem/Identifier/flexibleSpace] strings as the first and last elements of the array to center the remaining toolbar items. If you add custom identifiers, you must also override the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTabViewController/toolbar(_:itemForItemIdentifier:willBeInsertedIntoToolbar:)] method to specify the content for those toolbar items.

If you override this method, you must call `super` at some point in your implementation. The default implementation of this method returns the identifiers for all toolbar items that correspond to tabs in the tab bar interface.

## Responding to Toolbar Events

- **toolbar(_:itemForItemIdentifier:willBeInsertedIntoToolbar:)**: Returns the toolbar item for the specified identifier.
- **toolbarAllowedItemIdentifiers(_:)**: Returns the array of identifier strings for the allowed toolbar items.
- **toolbarSelectableItemIdentifiers(_:)**: Returns the array of identifier strings for the selectable toolbar items

items.description: Returns the toolbar item for the specified identifier.
items.name: toolbar(_:itemForItemIdentifier:willBeInsertedIntoToolbar:)

items.description: Returns the array of identifier strings for the allowed toolbar items.
items.name: toolbarAllowedItemIdentifiers(_:)

items.description: Returns the array of identifier strings for the selectable toolbar items
items.name: toolbarSelectableItemIdentifiers(_:)
